1.5 The Emergency Response Program

The Emergency Response Program is divided into two elements, as only properly trained and qualified personnel are authorized to respond to emergencies.  CF & contracted production workers are trained to notify and evacuate via the Plant’s Emergency Action Plan.  CF and/or WPS maintenance personnel would respond defensively to maintenance issues within the limits of their qualifications and PPE.  The MCAS & City of Yuma Fire Departments would respond to an emergency; additional support would be made available via CF & WPS personnel trained to 29 CFR 1910.120(q) standards.  Appropriate written plans are maintained on-site and updated on a regular basis.  Local Emergency Response capabilities have been verified.

 Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

Over the years it became apparent in the industry that a mishap while draining oil from the system is one of the most common incidents to occur.  Special self-closing valves are now installed as a permissive for oil drain flow.  If a release were to develop during an oil-draining task, the mechanic simply releases the handle of the self-closing valve and flow is terminated.  The facility has installed these types of valves at its’ system oil drain points. Company policy is that oil-draining may not commence unless these valves are installed.

Other release prevention steps taken at Cool Fresh, LLC:

­	Automatic Cutouts and Isolation Valves: Pressure and temperature controls are installed in accordance with appropriate standards. Refrigerating equipment includes automated cut-outs and isolation valves. The cut-outs are designed to shut down equipment prior to out-of-tolerance conditions being met. Isolation valves would help limit the impact of a release scenario.
­	Monitoring & Alarm System: refrigerated building space is equipped with ammonia sensors and a monitored alarm system.

Accidental Release Prevention Program

A comprehensive Process Safety Management (PSM) Program has been established in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.119.  The PSM Program is specifically intended to prevent accidental releases & promote the safe operation of ammonia-handling equipment and processes.  PSM is an integral part of daily Plant operation.  The written PSM document is maintained in the site’s online RMP/PSM Management solution called WBBM (Web-based Business Manager).

Monitoring and maintenance of the refrigeration equipment is a coordinated effort. CF personnel are responsible for day-to-day monitoring and operational maintenance.  WPS supports technical inspections & maintenance of the ammonia refrigeration equipment.  CF & WPS have developed comprehensive written procedures for the operation and maintenance of ammonia-handling equipment, including the steps to be taken in the event of a release or threatened release. 1.2 General Description of the Stationary Source and Regulated Substances

The Cool Fresh LLC facility is in a commercial/light industrial area, in an industrial area of Yuma, located at 4193 South Avenue 3 ½ E just east of the Marine Corp Air Station. It is immediately surrounded by other cooling facilities and local farms. The overall site occupies 10 acres; with a total building space of 44,880 square feet which includes 39,800 square feet dedicated to cold storage & 2,200 square feet for pressure pre-cooling. This facility is designed for seasonal fresh produce vacuum cooling, pressure pre-cooling, short-term temperature-controlled storage and shipping, and utilizes a portable high-side compressing / condensing trailer to support the Cooler.  Several independent, portable closed-loop vacuum cooling plants are also utilized, which is a configuration common to the industry. The primary commodities handled include leafy greens. The stationary portions of the facility were new in late October of 2018; the facility is permitted by the City of Yuma and was constructed according to the codes & standards in effect at that time.  Fire and life safety systems are engineered directly into the Plant as part of its design and code compliance requirements. Land, buildings, and stationary equipment are owned by WPS. Cool Fresh LLC is the operating entity owned WPS 50% and Gary Anthony 50%.  Portable equipment is either owned in partnerships and leased to Cool Fresh; or leased from WPS.  WPS is a regional, well-known & reputable supplier of portable refrigerating equipment.

Forward: This is a 5-Year RMP update submittal for Cool Fresh LLC (CF).  CF is an established fresh produce cooling facility in Yuma, AZ which employs multiple closed-loop ammonia processes, each of which are under the 10K lbs. Risk Management rule threshold and are separated by distance.  CF is participating in the RMP Program voluntarily due to its commitment to the safety of the facility, community, and the environment.  This Risk Management Plan voluntarily considers its ammonia operations as one closed-loop process.

1	EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

1.1 Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies

The Cool Fresh LLC (CF) Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies are simply not to have accidental releases or emergencies.  The Company endeavors to execute this policy through the daily implementation of its Safety Programs, which includes both the EPA Risk Management Program and OSHA’s Process Safety Management Programs.  CF has developed their RMP / PSM Manual to document policies addressing the implementation of the regulations governing these programs.  The Process Safety Management (PSM) sections pertain to the prevention of accidental releases and include the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA), procedures for operating, training, maintenance, emergency response, and others.  The RMP sections pertain to management systems, accident history and include the Hazard Assessment (Offsite Consequence Analysis-OCA) Report.  Nuances between the RMP & PSM Programs have been integrated according to Guidance documents published by USEPA.  

The PSM Program is an integrated approach to the safe operation of processes using Regulated Substances and forms the Program Level 3 Prevention Program component of the RMP.  The PSM Program is specifically designed and intended to prevent accidental releases, and to deal safely with emergencies if and when they do happen.
